comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: The petrodollar agreement supported the dollar for long periods, but in recent years the influence of the United States and the distribution of the dollar and US bonds in all central bank reserves makes it an independent currency from oil and does not need it. Therefore, indeed, we have oil, the dollar, and gold, and all of them may not be completely linked to each other.Shale oil mining and the huge quantities of oil in Venezuela will prevent oil prices from rising beyond $150 per barrel.
